humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states 'LYMPH NODES, RIGHT AXILLA, DISSECTION: POSITIVE FOR METASTATIC CARCINOMA (2/16) . SIZE OF LARGEST METASTASIS: 0.8 CM, NO EXTRACAPSULAR EXTENSION. PATHOLOGIC STAGE (TNM CLASSIFICATION) : pT2 pN1a.' This indicates that there are 2 out of 16 lymph nodes that are positive for metastatic carcinoma, which corresponds to N1a stage.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that a right axillary node was positive on FNA (fine needle aspiration), and that of the 16 lymph nodes examined during the axillary dissection, 2 were found to be positive for metastatic carcinoma. Therefore, the patient's N stage is N1 (1-3 positive axillary nodes).
